item.title: 6.042J
item.description: proofs introduction to proofs a proposition is a statement that is either true or false the $::=$ means ‚Äúequal by definition‚Äù and usually just $=$ is used you can‚Äôt check a claim about an infinite set by checking a finite set of elements symbols $\forall$ for all $\mathbb{N}$ nonnegative integers $\in$ is in, is a member of, belongs to $\mathbb{Z}^+$ positive integers Proposition.

item.title: Classes
item.description: All courses were taken at UW-Madison unless otherwise specified. spring 2023 CS 577: Introduction to Algorithms CS 540: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence CS 354: Machine Organization and Programming MATH 431: Introduction to the Theory of Probability MATH 521: Analysis I fall 2022 CS 475: Introduction to Combinatorics CS 252: Introduction to Computer Engineering ECE 537: Communication Networks PHYSICS 201: General Physics MSE 299: Independent Study (ML4ER) summer 2022 (self-studied) CS 220: Data Programming I CS 61A: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs UC-Berkeley previous CS 300: Programming I (SU ‘20) CS 400: Programming II (FA ‘20) MATH 20804232: Calculus and Analytic Geometry 2 (SU ‘21) Madison College MATH 234: Calculus - Functions of Several Variables (FA ‘21) MATH 341: Linear Algebra (SP ‘22)

item.title: coding shortcuts
item.description: Python list comprehensions are the bane of my existence 1 2 # y satisfying both conditions [y for y in range(100) if y % 2 == 0 if y % 5 == 0] find the max and min of a Series 1 2 3 4 5 6 s = Series s.

item.title: CS 220
item.description: Self-paced course taken summer ‘22, linked here. Introductory data science programming using Python – teaches Python basics, programming fundamentals, and data science modules in Python.

item.title: CS 61A
item.description: Self-paced course taken summer ‘22, linked here. Beginner programming course using Python – teaches data abstraction, … Great focus on shortcuts and problem-solving with code; has hints of competitive coding strategies.

item.title: Stream
item.description: This serves as a hub for all of my recent edits on my website. All of my writing is organized into three categories ‚Äî seed (üå∞) for quick thoughts, leaf (üåø) for revised ideas, and fruit (ü•≠) for completed blog posts.

item.title: Ubuntu 22.04 with UTM
item.description: No easy way to dual boot with the M1 chips – UTM is a software specifically for macOS to run VMs or emulate other machines How to create a new Ubuntu VM: Install the 22.
